alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 31 at 6:53PM PST until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 648 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding, including water ponding on roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Minor rock and mudslides may affect canyon roads. Poor visibility expected during heavier rain. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 3.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Ojai, Chatsworth, Woodland Hills, Moorpark, Santa Paula, Port Hueneme, Rose Valley, Ventura Harbor, Lockwood Valley, Newbury Park, La Conchita, Point Mugu State Park and Rincon Point. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
